goals.question: What is the distribution of the number of stars for the repositories?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the popularity of the repositories based on the number of stars they have received.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the number of forks for the repositories?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand how many times the repositories have been forked, which can give us an idea of how many people are interested in contributing to the project.

goals.question: What is the relationship between the number of stars and the number of forks for the repositories?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of the 'stars' and 'forks' fields
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between the popularity of the repositories (number of stars) and the number of people interested in contributing to the project (number of forks).

goals.question: What is the distribution of the programming languages used in the repositories?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand which programming languages are most commonly used in the repositories, which can give us an idea of the technology trends in the open source community.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the number of contributors for the repositories?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand how many people have contributed to the repositories, which can give us an idea of the size of the development community around the project.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['stars'] = pd.to_numeric(data['stars'], errors='coerce')
    plt.hist(data['stars'], bins=20, color='blue', edgecolor='black')
    plt.axvline(data['stars'].median(), color='red', label='Median: {:.2f}'.format(data['stars'].median()))
    plt.xlabel('Number of Stars')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the number of stars for the repositories?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['forks'] = pd.to_numeric(data['forks'], errors='coerce')
    plt.hist(data['forks'], bins=20, color='green', alpha=0.75)
    plt.axvline(data['forks'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f'Median: {data["forks"].median():.2f}')
    plt.xlabel('Number of Forks')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.legend(loc='best')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['stars'] = pd.to_numeric(data['stars'], errors='coerce')
    data['forks'] = pd.to_numeric(data['forks'], errors='coerce')
    plt.scatter(data['stars'], data['forks'])
    plt.title('What is the relationship between the number of stars and the number of forks for the repositories?')
    plt.xlabel('Stars')
    plt.ylabel('Forks')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['language'].value_counts().plot(kind='bar')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the programming languages used in the repositories?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['contributors'] = pd.to_numeric(data['contributors'], errors='coerce')
    data = data.dropna(subset=['contributors'])
    plt.hist(data['contributors'], bins=20, color='green')
    plt.axvline(data['contributors'].median(), color='red', label='Median: {:.2f}'.format(data['contributors'].median()))
    plt.xlabel('Number of Contributors')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the number of contributors for the repositories?', wrap=True)
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
